front.name: Axel Clauberg
front.quote: "The best way to predict the future is to invent it." Alan Kay

back.lesson: I learned this early in my international management career when my direct German feedback culture made me act like a bull in a china shop. A Global Mindset and Cultural Intelligence is critical for psychological safety in any team.
advice: Don't complain, own! Ownership is a critical element of a Day1 innovation culture.
Your opinion is too important to be silent, bring it in, show backbone.
Fail often (and learn from it).

front.name: Eric Johnson
front.quote: "Do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God" - Micah 6:8

back.lesson: On lesson I have learned is to expect and embrace mistakes. When a mistake happens, own it, correct if possible, and move on.
advice: If you are the smartest person in the room, find a new room. Put yourself in a situation to learn.
Correct privately, praise publically, and never be stingy with knowledge.
Kindness and conflict are not mutually exclusive. Learn to express your opinion and stand your ground without the tearing down of others.

front.name: Margo Cronin
front.quote: The mind is a wonderful servant and terrible master.

back.lesson: I have learnt more from my failures than my successes. Successes are great for morale, failures are great for successes (and write minutes)
advice: Becoming a manager should not be a promotion. Good people manager have a skill in that functionality.
When you dont know what you want to do, write out what you dont want to do.
Just start.....If you want to be a writer, just write....etc.

front.name: Jonathan Allen
front.quote: All of your assumed constraints are debatable.

back.lesson: Work from First Principles, challenge your assumptions, reduce requirements to the bare minimum, make sure every requirement has an individuals name on it.
advice: You will always be too busy, motivation doesn't work, develop mechanisms for daily learning.
Give your customers what they want, make them happy.
Don't optimize something that should not exist.

front.name: Miriam McLemore
front.quote: Leadership lessons

back.lesson: Building networks and identifying opportunities for value creation is essential.
advice: The importance of building networks and identifying gaps and opportunities
Push through imposter syndrome and take on challenges without hesitation
Be willing to take risks and don't wait on the sidelines

front.name: Miguel Álava Tejera
front.quote: "Leading Without Authority" - Keith Ferrazzi

back.lesson: You never know what the future holds, so do what you do with the understanding that the legacy of your actions and the impact of your learning will last forever.
advice: Technology will always evolve at a faster pace; therefore, our ability to learn and prioritize should grow at an equally rapid pace.
Being right or wrong is worthless. What truly matters is perceiving and solving relevant problems.
The best way to convince someone is to make them believe they are convincing you about what you want them to be convinced of.

front.name: Tomas Jan Soderstrom
front.quote: "Perfection is the enemy of progress"

back.lesson: One lesson learned for demos to executives is to show only the business outcome. Then ask if they want to do more.
advice: Prioritize Learn and Be Curious, especially on the business outcomes side.
Demonstrate bias for action as it will help to earn trust with customers, peers, management, and executives.
Take every opportunity to speak and write in public and tell a story.

front.name: David Elliott
front.quote: 'Ego, Authority, Failure' by Derek Gaunt

back.lesson: In tough situations, emotions can run high. Be aware of what triggers you and learn to use this as an opportunity to dive deeper and look into why.
advice: 'Every Day is a School Day'. There is always something new to learn in all situations.
Keep learning and growing
Stay humble and open to new ideas

front.name: Danilo Poccia
front.quote: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication" - Leonardo Da Vinci

back.lesson: Many technologies come and go, but real user needs remain constant. Build deep expertise in understanding requirements and solving practical problems.
advice: When you have a choice, follow your passions and curiosity.
Don't just learn a concept but learn to explain it to someone else.
In any conversation, listening is more important than talking.

front.name: Ran Tessler
front.quote: "Trust takes years to build, seconds to break, and forever to repair"

back.lesson: You cannot do it all. Be deliberate in what you choose to invest in. Be clear in communicating in what you will not.
advice: Always provide customers with advice you would have followed if you were in their seat.
There are no ideal solutions. There are solutions that best fit your customer needs.
Speak up. You don't need to be loud. You need to be clear.

front.name: Gus Santana
front.quote: "Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care." - Theodore Roosevelt

back.lesson: Architectures changes every 2 to 3 years. Even if you write a technical book, it will be outdated after some time. Your true legacy is the people you help.
advice: We are not in the tech business. Many decisions are emotional. We are all in the people business.
My mission as a manager is that people that work in my team, leave closer to their purpose
If you are not working in your career plan, you are probably working on someone's else

front.name: Julian Wood
front.quote: Nelson Mandela: What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived

back.lesson: People work best as individuals within teams. A group is more than the sum of its parts.
advice: Be curious, explore, and share. You learn best when you dive down the rabbit hole.
Keep high standards. Avoid cutting corners.
Be kind, empathetic, and help others.

front.name: Phil Le-Brun
front.quote: If I had an hour to solve a problem I'd spend 55 minutes thinking about the problem

back.lesson: Always prioritise people and communications. Everything we do requires people to come on a journey.
advice: Migrations are not transformations, they are the start of a transformation.
Prioritise "no regrets" decisions.
There is no such thing as a technology project.

front.name: Stephan Hadinger
front.quote: Nelson Mandela - I never lose. I either win or learn

back.lesson: Always address the customer CEO. No customer is won until the CEO decides.
advice: What customer have, what they want and what they need are often 3 different things
"Say no to say yes". It is sometimes necessary to say NO to a customer
At AWS, you will never be able to do everything you are been asked to

front.name: Arthur Bailey
front.quote: You can kill a man, but you can't kill an idea

back.lesson: Doing your homework is the foundation of your future success.
advice: Accept that long-term success is always earned
Inspire others by the example you set
Be present and be humble

front.name: Chris Hennesey
front.quote: "Your network is your net worth" -- Tim Sanders

back.lesson: As you progress through your career, it is important to know that as you begin to manage others - you are still accountable for their work.
advice: Build and manage your network
Stay current. Continuously learn
Money provides options - save and invest

front.name: Margaret O'Toole
front.quote: The Wizard and the Prophet: Two Remarkable Scientists and Their Dueling Visions

back.lesson: Productive doesn't necessarily mean busy. It is incredibly important to make sure you protect time to think and reflect.
advice: Always be willing to step back and look at the situation from another's perspective
If you ever feel like you're the "dumbest" person in the room, try to think of this as an opportunity
Make someone else tell you no

front.name: Elena Rudenko
front.quote: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication" – Leonardo da Vinci

back.lesson: Ability to pause and reflect goes a long way. The loudest voice in the room is rarely heard.
advice: Trust your choices
Be bold. Ask for forgiveness, not permission
Build a support network. In and out of office

front.name: Mark Birch
front.quote: "Do what you love in the service of people who love what you do" – Steve Farber, The Radical Leap

back.lesson: You have to be willing to reinvent yourself in your career.
advice: Embrace serendipity
Be more helpful
Work does not define you, vision does

front.name: Martyn Storey
front.quote: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind by Yuval Noah Harari

back.lesson: I have learned that it is critical to have a closed customer feedback loop. The loop has to be facilitated by three things: Data capture, Effective tools, and Buy in from stakeholders.
advice: Don't ever be afraid to go out of ones comfort zone
Learn from people of all backgrounds and experiences
Leadership is about leading from the front

front.name: Kamil Davidov
front.quote: #DiaryOfACEO with Steven Bartlett and Jimmy Carr. PodCast!

back.lesson: Quality over Quantity: Make the time you spend with your family and with colleges count. Even if you're busy, focus on quality interactions like meaningful conversations or activities that strengthen your bond.
advice: Be Kind to Yourself: No one can do it all perfectly. Accept that some days will be chaotic, and that's okay
Outsource When Possible: Whether it's hiring help with housework, childcare, or meal prep, outsource some tasks to free up valuable time
Set Boundaries: Clearly define when you're working and when you're with your family. Communicate these boundaries to both your employer and your family

front.name: Rahul Shukla
front.quote: S. Jobs: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma—which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.

back.lesson: Find the best team, and best leaders to go work with and learn from. You will learn the most in the shortest period of time and be able to make an impact that matters. Ultimately that will move your career faster than any other proxies - titles, comp, number of people who report to you etc.
advice: Don't let your current job role define your impact and contributions to the organization. Eliminate guardrails and organizational barriers
Be Curious. Learn and innovate. You learn most by sharing. So lean in to share your time, expertise and insights to those in need
Surround yourself with talent and leaders who are much better than you. Each hire should raise the capability of the team in new ways

front.name: Colin Bonney
front.quote: Plato: A wise person will talk because they have something to say

back.lesson: Your work is just that, don't let it consume your life, ensure you can switch off from it
advice: Learn as much as you can consume and can put into practice
Manage upwards, its important that your management know you
Be helpful to others, after all you never know when you may need help

front.name: Armando Martines Neto
front.quote: The people who don't ask questions remain clueless throughout their lives

back.lesson: Things will go wrong, it is not about to prevent problems, but to be prepared to deal with it when it happens!
advice: Learn from others! in the IT industry is important to identify what successful people are doing
Talk about your ideas to others, hear different point of views
Set your targets! think where you want to be in 5-10-15 years

front.name: Matthias Patzak
front.quote: Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software

back.lesson: A job is just a job. Focus on delivering business value and results.
advice: Be clear about whether your career path lies in management or in IC
Never settle. Stay curious. Read! Share. Learn
Do what you love

front.name: Tobias Börjeson
front.quote: People who are right most of the time are people who change their minds often

back.lesson: One significant lesson I've learned is the power of adaptability and constant forward motion
advice: Always expand your personal network, learn new skills constantly
Maintaining a relentless curiosity and growth mindset has been crucial
Never stop letting your curiosity guide you

front.name: Brandon Carroll
front.quote: "Let's go invent tomorrow instead of worrying about what happened yesterday" -- Steve Jobs

back.lesson: You don't have to have it all figured out at the start of your career
advice: To accelerate your career, accept that you will never know it all
Working in Tech is a marathon, not a sprint
Change your vocabulary and change your outcome

front.name: Norihisa Tsuruta
front.quote: "The best way to predict the future is to create it" - Peter Drucker

back.lesson: In the IT industry, where change is rapid, adaptability to new environments is most critical for us.
advice: It is desirable to acquire deep tech skills that will serve as your core foundation
For anything, it is important to take responsibility and see it through to the end
Follow the rules, don't make the same mistake, and accept failure and take next action

front.name: Sebastien Stormacq
front.quote: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B012BLTM6I

back.lesson: Respect diverse perspectives and opinions. Everyone brings unique value to the table.
advice: Don't limit yourself to a single niche. Stay curious and explore different areas of tech
Continuously learn and be curious
Prioritize learning and stay curious

front.name: Anonymous
front.quote: Work hard, have fun, make history (Jeff Bezos)

back.lesson: You will always find people who know much more than you, try to leverage them to boost your skills
advice: Learn and be curious. Tech industry is evolving super fast
Ownership. Don't expect from others to build a plan for you
Enjoy what you do

front.name: Mark Schwartz
front.quote: Read great literature and philosophy books, not business or business technology books!

back.lesson: A lesson from sales: Always be Closing. I had to learn to close deals rather than leaving things vague or open.
advice: Take on roles that require ownership and hard decisions, not just advisory
All problems can be solved - just keep trying!
It's important to engage people in the organization, because you can't do it alone

front.name: Brooke Jamieson
front.quote: "Share your truth, it is your power" - Grace Tame

back.lesson: Always think about how you'll explain a feature/project/product to someone else.
advice: Take charge of your own learning & development
Tech changes all the time, but your values don't
Be who you needed when you were younger

front.name: Nithya Ruff
front.quote: Growth Mindset by Carol S. Dweck and Working Backwards by Colin Bryar and Bill Carr

back.lesson: An important transformation I made was when I first became a people manager.
advice: Be in charge of your own career
Leadership is about owning your space and becoming an expert at your craft
Good communications skills and growth mindset are essential

front.name: Matt Wood
front.quote: "Innovation is seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody has thought"

back.lesson: Commoditize your embarrassment—don't let the fear of judgment silence your creativity.
advice: Stay curious: embrace new ideas, ask questions, and explore beyond your comfort zone
Ask for forgiveness, not permission
In periods of discontinuous change, act as a merry band of pirates not a supertanker

front.name: Yoji Harada
front.quote: "It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change"

back.lesson: Don't get stuck in chasing after your next level too much, rather focus on what you can do now.
advice: Be intentional for career development
People always matters. Be humble, respect and appreciate
Learn from good managers, but more importantly from bad managers

front.name: Anonymous
front.quote: Everything fails, all of the time - Werner Vogels

back.lesson: I've learned the importance of having mentors for all stages of my career.
advice: Treat yourself like your own customer and work backwards with yourself
Never stop learning but remember it isn't just technology
Remember you can't help anyone else if you don't help yourself

front.name: Matheus Guimaraes
front.quote: Various quotes about success, doubt, and passion

back.lesson: Technology will always evolve, and so should you.
advice: Much like learning another language, immerse yourself with topics you want to learn
My passion married with my willingness to go the extra mile
Fall in love with learning!

front.name: Nitin Bawankule
front.quote: "Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other" -John F. Kennedy

back.lesson: One lesson I have learnt is, irrespective of however good your tech/solution is, what matters most is 'How can it solve the real life problem'.
advice: You are the architect of your career
One key metric of success changes as you grow
Think Big, bold - not only for the customers and solutions, but also for your career

front.name: Sundar Ram VG
front.quote: Growth Mindset by Prof. Carol Dweck helped me a lot

back.lesson: Never tie yourself to a "Godfather" like figure. Always stand on your merit, network, and personality.
advice: Always remember that career progression starts with 3 things: curiosity, help others, and challenge yourself
Three key components for success in writing, communication, and leadership
Take time to know yourself and stay humble

front.name: Rafael Bautista
front.quote: The book "The Go-Giver"

back.lesson: One lesson is to focus on fewer things and prioritize your tasks
advice: The tech industry can be complex and fast-paced, so focus your efforts strategically
Connect with Your Passion and continuously learn
Face new challenges head-on, even when fearful

front.name: Kathy Kam
front.quote: TED talk "Grid: The Power of Passion and Perseverance"

back.lesson: The most important decision I make day to day is not what I do, but what I consciously deprioritized and not do.
advice: Tech industry is ever innovating and evolving
The best leaders I know have "Grit"
There is always something you can learn from the people around you

front.name: Hiroyuki Tsutsumi
front.quote: Quotes about simplicity and sophistication

back.lesson: Great technology is appreciated, but it is not always accepted by the market.
advice: Keep up to date with the latest social and market conditions and trends
Looking at things over a fairly long time span
Always be challenging and follow the three rules for challenges

front.name: Amelie Clugnet
front.quote: Focus on Think big in your scope of role

back.lesson: Focus on Think big in your scope of role. We have all the ability to innovate.
advice: Don't think about your next move as a final destination but where it is going to take you
Learn and be curious is critical to be successful in our environment
Don't wait for jobs to be published. Best jobs are like apartments, they often don't appear on the web

front.name: Donnie Prakoso
front.quote: Memento mori — Remember, you must die. Make the most out of your day, everyday!

back.lesson: Technology is just an enabler for business. Think about the value you're giving, not how you're going to deliver.
advice: If you want to accelerate, you need to beat the learning curves
Write anything and everything
Define your workflow and be disciplined

front.name: Anonymous
front.quote: "Be the change you want to see in the world." - Ghandi

back.lesson: Simple is better. In Leadership - clarity of purpose brings teams together.
advice: Position yourself to be agile and willing to try multiple disciplines
Be humble, but strive for greatness
Earn trust always

front.name: Jeff Barr
front.quote: "Before we work on artificial intelligence why don't we do something about natural stupidity?"

back.lesson: Be willing to politely yet firmly say "No, I cannot" when people ask you to do just one more thing.
advice: Set some short and medium term goals, get a good mentor
Respect past technological developments while remaining open to future developments
Take that fork in the road when opportunities arise

front.name: James Horsley
front.quote: "A rising tide lifts all boats" & "united we stand, divided we fall"

back.lesson: To quote The Office "business is about people."
advice: Identify the things you want as a customer and make them happen
Your work isn't you. Don't take things personally
Stay curious, always be learning

front.name: Ushio Usami
front.quote: FREAK NOMICS RADIO

back.lesson: When I started working in 1986, I learnt based on IBM mainframe technology. Even in the cloud age, the challenges are common.
advice: Understandings of technology vision rather than diving deep specific technology
Communication skills with business leaders
Think about how you can make the world better

front.name: Farhin Khan
front.quote: Careers are a jungle gym, not a ladder - Sheryl Sandberg

back.lesson: As a woman in tech, one of the most significant lessons I've learned is the importance of being authentic and embracing vulnerability.
advice: Adopt a proactive, self-starter mindset
R.A.P.I.D: Resilient, Adaptable, Proactive, Innovative, Determined
Embrace self-advocacy and sponsorship

front.name: Martin Elwin
front.quote: Podcast: The Amp Hour

back.lesson: To achieve something it's often better to make a quick decision and then iterating on it.
advice: Be open to try different things
Always consider not only what you communicate, but also how you communicate it
Given different relevant options, focus on what you most enjoy doing

front.name: Mahin Sonia
front.quote: The Surprising Solution to Imposter Syndrome

back.lesson: Build your network. We should always focus on ensuring we build our network of professionals.
advice: Never be afraid to take risks
Always have a mentor
Build your brand on LinkedIn

front.name: Adrian De Luca
front.quote: Creativity thrives in an environment where mistakes are tolerated and experimentation is encouraged

back.lesson: One lesson I've learned is you need to do a lot of listening all of the time.
advice: Sustaining a long and fruitful career in the tech industry requires constant learning
Great leaders know when to lead from the front or behind
While many tend to believe Intelligence Quotient (IQ) is the most critical skill, Adaptability Quotient (AQ) is far more valuable

front.name: Chris Casey
front.quote: Andy's letter of gratitude to the AWS team

back.lesson: Asking open ended questions that start with How?, What?, Where? are powerful thought provoking questions.
advice: Have goals but mentally note that you're always a work in progress
Where and how you show up consistently as a leader speaks loudly
It doesn't cost you anything extra to be a good person

front.name: Matty Noble
front.quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's there are few

back.lesson: The most important lesson I learned is the importance of clear communication.
advice: Learn about what your leadership really cares about
I gravitate towards projects where I have to break the rules to succeed
Seek out people in other job roles that complement your own

front.name: Luca Mezzarila
front.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step - Lao Tzu

back.lesson: In life, you never truly lose. You either win or learn, and in both cases, it's a success.
advice: Push yourself outside your comfort zone
Distributed systems are living systems
Continuous learning

front.name: Ricardo Sueiras
front.quote: Focus on building networks and relationships

back.lesson: Communication - Even as technologists, understand how to communicate.
advice: Take a breath - People make bad decisions when they are panicked
Look for the gaps – being able to look beyond your own remit
Set long term goals – failure to have a mission for yourself

front.name: Shalini Kapoor
front.quote: Lessons in Chemistry by Bonnie Garmus

back.lesson: We need to be massively prepared for transformations in products, customers' behaviours, organizational design and practices.
advice: Put up your hand for the most challenging assignment
To become a learner at all points
Be kind, respectful and sensitive to diversity

front.name: John Davies
front.quote: The squiggly career

back.lesson: "A, B, SC") Always be scaling!
advice: Breadth (horizontal moves) are disproportionately important in early years
Audit yourself and your business frequently
Never lose the curiosity of youth

front.name: Jason Bath
front.quote: Read Swim with Sharks without being eaten!

back.lesson: Remember your value and ensure you are rewarded for it
advice: Have a plan. Write it down
Manage your brand
Communicate complex topics simply

front.name: Tom Godden
front.quote: na

back.lesson: It is about business value nothing else
advice: Be willing to say yes to opportunities
Being self critical
Develop strong business understanding

front.name: Roland Barcia
front.quote: Jeff Bezos quote about process as proxy

back.lesson: Don't get overly religious over a particular technology or process
advice: Do not lose your passion to learn something new
Aim for substance over check boxes
Do not solve for "Reuse"

front.name: Adam Seligman
front.quote: I love that someone said they wish generative AI could take care of the boring things for creative people instead of doing creative things for boring people

back.lesson: You can't be a subject matter expert in everything. But you can form strong clear opinions and products benefit from that greatly.
advice: Stay technically curious, try technologies and form and informed opinion
I've learned that people want leaders to provide clarity
Your reputation carries with you your whole career

front.name: Rianne van Veldhuizen
front.quote: A ship in harbor is safe — but that is not what ships are built for

back.lesson: One of the most important lessons I've learned is the value of staying focused and driving towards tangible, measurable outcomes.
advice: Get a mentor!
Embracing change with a sense of excitement and curiosity
Stay true to your authentic self

front.name: Yukiko Sato
front.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal. It is the courage to continue that counts

back.lesson: The important thing is not to "win", but to show respect and cooperation.
advice: Find an environment with respectable bosses and colleagues
Believe in yourself. Have courage and take action
Don't lose sight of the long-term perspective

front.name: Rejean Bourgault
front.quote: Take Vacations, no one will reward you for not taking vacations.

back.lesson: The best keynote speeches are done only with Images in the background.
advice: Best advice would be to continue Learn and Be Curious
Stay Humble and Authentic in all you do
Be good on stage, like very good.

front.name: Soo Lee
front.quote: Masters of Scale - Let fires burn episode

back.lesson: Do not let yourself, your idea get bullied out when you are convicted it's the right thing for the business.
advice: The bar is constantly changing at Amazon/AWS and the industry
Be tactically impatient while being strategically patient
Speed disproportionately matters

front.name: Jens Greiner
front.quote: "Love it, change it or leave it!" This quote helped me to stay healthy, happy and successful.

back.lesson: As a technical expert, you can deal with a higher complexity than your customers and stakeholders. Break it down in small, valuable junks and communicate it in your customers language.
advice: Be very clear what you want to be, but don't focus on career development, focus on what you're passioned about
Stay current with the latest technological advancements to fully comprehend their problem-solving capabilities
Take risks and don't be afraid of failing

front.name: Jorrit Van der Meulen
front.quote: "failure and invention are inseparable twins" - Jeff Bezos

back.lesson: Work backwards from the customer. Build what you think they will appreciate. Start there.
advice: Follow your curiosity and your passion. Focus on developing your skills and expertise and good things will follow.
A high degree of curiosity and desire to learn. Be ready to fail. Embrace it and learn from it.
I manage my career by four principles: passion, challenge, people, and fair compensation

front.name: Alex Martinez
front.quote: The Hard Thing About Hard Things: Building a Business When There Are No Easy Answers

back.lesson: Be willing to tackle the hard problems; shortcuts today lead to detours tomorrow.
advice: Focus on getting more experience on real customer problems
I've found achieving long term success is more about the people you meet along the journey than the technology
Learn the business, then learn your customer's business

front.name: Luca Mezzalira
front.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step - Lao Tzu

back.lesson: In life, you never really lose—you either win or learn, and both are successes!
advice: Stepping outside your comfort zone boosts personal growth
Continuous learning helps us grow our skills and knowledge
To solidify your knowledge, teach others what you've learned

front.name: Geries AbouAyash
front.quote: It does not get easier, you just get better!

back.lesson: As a leader, I need to constantly look for how I am scaling myself and getting my team to deliver at the highest levels.
advice: It starts by continuously being in a learn & be curious mindset
In your daily routines, you will find yourself constantly reacting to things
Take time to build your mentorship circle and your stakeholder network

front.name: Arvind Mathur
front.quote: There is no such thing as best in a world of individuals!

back.lesson: Adoption is everything. Plan your product in a way that early customers become advocates for future waves of adoption.
advice: Look out for and develop mentors, coaches and advocates
Speak up - you are closest to the ground
Throw yourself at opportunities that get you out of your comfort zone

front.name: Nicola Gerber
front.quote: "There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them."

back.lesson: We are privileged to be part of an exciting journey that can redefine the way we live, work and interact.
advice: Be deliberate in where you want to be
Don't look for affirmation before you do something
If you like how a person models what you think you're aspiring towards, learn from them

front.name: Sandra Teh
front.quote: Mahatma Gandhi - In a gentle way, you can shake the world.

back.lesson: Anyone can be an innovator. A good idea can come from anyone, literally.
advice: Mentor someone just like how you appreciate mentorship
If you don't spot another in the room that looks like you, speak up and be that critical voice
Build your personal branding and be that thought leader, not just any leader

front.name: Massimo Re Ferre
front.quote: "The world is flat" by Thomas Friedman

back.lesson: One thing I learned in 30 years is that, finding the product market fit is a piece of art.
advice: There is so much that is going on these days in tech. Be curious
There are many ways to achieve long-term success in tech
Keep your hands dirty while trying to see the big picture

front.name: Mike Eastman
front.quote: General Colin Powell Leadership Lessons

back.lesson: The most important lesson that i have learned as an executive is to drive simplification.
advice: Get out of your comfortably zone
Staying positive and leading with purpose
Building genuine emotional connections

front.name: Adam Driver
front.quote: "Be more concerned with character than reputation. Character is what you are, reputation is what people think you are." - John Wooden

back.lesson: We all have a niche with technology where our expertise shines bright and loud, don't try to dominate the room with your expertise. We learn more by listening than speaking.
advice: Take More Risks with your career
Stay Motivated with Hard Work and try to learn something each day
Pick your Battles - You can't win every hard opinion and decision and determine your must-wins and then dig in for those, but let the others go

front.name: Tanuja Randery
front.quote: It always seems impossible until it's done - Nelson Mandela

back.lesson: It takes a village … get all the help you can get and it's not about work life balance. It's balancing your time, prioritising and leaning into sponsors and a board of advisors. You are not alone.
advice: Take the opportunities as they come and be proactive .. you are the person responsible for your career
A desire to have outsized impact, to transform the world, and knowing I could do the impossible if I tried hard enough and leveraged an amazing team
Calibrate don't catastrophise a friend once told me.. don't be too hard on yourself and enjoy every min of the learning, the failures and the successes

front.name: Anandhi Bumstead
front.quote: Trust is the new currency of our interdependent, collaborative world - Stephen M.R.Covey

back.lesson: Both Sides Now perspective - embracing this perspective is essential as we progress in our careers and find joy in doing what we do best.
advice: Take the time to deeply understand the domain and build the relevant experiences
Continuing to develop the growth mindset was the valuable habit
Paying attention to details is crucial, but it's also important to remember not to let the pursuit of perfection hinder progress

front.name: Greg PROULX
front.quote: The only constant in life is change - Heraclitus of Ephesus

back.lesson: One big lesson I've learned is that it's not just about "what" you produce with your work effort, but the "how" is also very important.
advice: I would say it's important to have a clear view and vision
The Amazon leadership principles are a great foundation
Always seek to understand, e.g., be a "truth seeker"

front.name: Justin Callison
front.quote: If everyone is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking - George S. Patton

back.lesson: Failure is a better teacher than success. This is a hard lesson to learn and failure never feels good.
advice: Be helpful - There are so many challenges facing every organization
Remain curious - Our industry moves so fast
It's a marathon, not a sprint

front.name: Brian Bohan
front.quote: Trust takes years to build, seconds to break, and forever to repair

back.lesson: You can't be a subject matter expert in everything. But you can form strong clear opinions and products benefit from that greatly.
advice: Three pieces of advice. First, look for those opportunities where you can solve difficult and complex problems
Be open to diverse and opposing points of view
Find mentors you will challenge your thinking and who will broaden your perspective

front.name: Brian Bohan
front.quote: Trust takes years to build, seconds to break, and forever to repair

back.lesson: You can't be a subject matter expert in everything. But you can form strong clear opinions and products benefit from that greatly.
advice: Three pieces of advice. First, look for those opportunities where you can solve difficult and complex problems
Be open to diverse and opposing points of view
Find mentors who will challenge your thinking and broaden your perspective

front.name: Danielle Gorlick
front.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it

back.lesson: The most important lesson I've learned is that success in technology isn't just about technical skills.
advice: Build strong relationships and networks
Stay curious and keep learning
Focus on delivering value to customers

front.name: Julien Lépine
front.quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil - Donald Knuth

back.lesson: Think of your planning horizon. When I get stuck on a project, reframing the project into what we need now and what we will need later helps avoiding losing a lot of time.
advice: Career growth is not a ladder, it is a map
Long term goals over tasks, be flexible and adaptable
Be stubborn on the vision, and flexible on the details

front.name: Melanie McGrory
front.quote: Success is not final. Failure is not fatal. Its the courage to continue that counts

back.lesson: The lesson I learnt early on is to focus on the outcome that you are trying to achieve and never, ever, write code that looks good but delivers a poor customer experience.
advice: I would say take a risk and do something outside of your comfort zone
Be prepared to be comfortable with being uncomfortable
Be Brave. Understand that not everything you try will be successful

front.name: Mike Choe
front.quote: Innovation is key to growth and success

back.lesson: Focus on continuous improvement and never stop learning.
advice: Always think about the customer first
Build strong relationships with your team
Stay updated with technology trends

front.name: Santanu Dutt
front.quote: When anecdotes and data do not match, generally the anecdotes are right - Jeff B

back.lesson: My younger naive self confused activity and being busy with productivity.
advice: Be open-minded and be highly Learn & Be Curious
Leadership is driving outcomes via influencing others by inspiring the team
Story telling is one of the most under-rated yet most powerful tools

front.name: Michael Rambold
front.quote: I believe you have to be willing to be misunderstood if you're going to innovate - Jeff Bezos

back.lesson: Always question the value add of what you do. Challenge requirements especially if it is getting too complicated.
advice: Build up a personal brand on what you are good at
Truth seeking and take ownership
Experiment and fail fast but keep track of your own well being and time

front.name: Tom Maddox
front.quote: Get A Grip: How to Get Everything You Want from Your Entrepreneurial Business

back.lesson: Getting ideas off the ground can feel like lugging a rock up a hill; try aligning them to the needs of your business.
advice: Surround yourself with people and businesses you want to learn from
Always jump in at the deep end and seek the opportunity in each challenge
Well thought through constructive feedback is the best thing that everyone can invest into you

front.name: Luke Anderson
front.quote: Do and Believe That Which Moves You Toward Your Goals – Tom Bilyeu

back.lesson: Always have an ask when engaging senior stakeholders - make it specific, relevant and remarkable.
advice: Have a clear plan of what you want to achieve and when
Operate with authenticity and transparency
Answer the "exam" question and get to the point

front.name: Toshi Yasuda
front.quote: "If the size of your failures isn't growing, you're not going to be inventing at a size that can actually move the needle" - Jeff Bezos

back.lesson: There is always an opportunity to think bigger. Keep pushing yourself.
advice: Get out of your comfortably zone. Stretch yourself
Tackle the largest problem you can solve
Focus on impacts you can create

front.name: Ben Cabanas
front.quote: Lights Out: Pride, Delusion, and the Fall of General Electric

back.lesson: We can not solve our problems with the same level of thinking that created them - Albert Einstein
advice: Build deep and differentiating subject-matter expertise in your career before breadth
Be committed to a journey of continuous improvement
If you are not putting yourself in uncomfortable situations on a daily basis, you are not growing!

front.name: Max Amordeluso
front.quote: Who Moved My Cheese? by Spencer Johnson

back.lesson: Don't be afraid of failure, embrace it, learn from it and persevere.
advice: You own your career, nobody else
I always try to look at the person behind the badge
Be curious

front.name: Adam Broda
front.quote: "Atomic Habits" - James Clear

back.lesson: One important lesson I have learned is to over communicate your vision and mission to the team.
advice: Be prepared to say "No" to a lot of things that aren't worthy of your time
Resist the temptation to manage/lead like the leaders you work for
Feedback is the life-blood of high-trust, high-performance team culture

front.name: CLEBER PEREIRA DE MORAIS
front.quote: Innovation and leadership in technology

back.lesson: Focus on continuous learning and adaptation in the fast-paced tech industry.
advice: Maintain a strong technical foundation
Build effective communication skills
Embrace change and new technologies

front.name: JC Gutierrez
front.quote: Gratefulness is to resilience, as exercising is to fitness

back.lesson: Be an owner of everything you do. You own your life and your career. Do not behave as a renter or a loaner of your life.
advice: Learning and Be Curious is a way of living, it is not a moment
This new era demands a shift in skills, mindsets, and the very nature of how humans approach their work
Build harmony in your life and careers

front.name: Michael Schmidt
front.quote: Take Vacations, no one will reward you for not taking vacations

back.lesson: There will be highs and lows. There will be many days when you want to quit, find another job, another team. Keep balance in your life, exercise, indulge hobbies and passions outside of work that excite you.
advice: Find good mentors but be intentional about what you work on together and time box it
Be authentic. People don't expect you to be perfect
Think ahead, anticipate challenges down the road and plan for different scenarios

front.name: Thiago de Faria
front.quote: Everything is relative; and only that is absolute - Augusto Comte

back.lesson: One lesson I learned is that every company that fails, every team that is unhappy, every deadline and specification that is not met... it never happens because of a tech problem. It's all people, communication and its social construct.
advice: Technical skills will change. You know what doesn't change? Working together
Not burning bridges and not hiding the real reason
Be kind. People are doing the best with the knowledge and context that they have

front.name: Ishit Vachhrajani
front.quote: Quote: Don't mistake activity with achievement - John Wooden

back.lesson: Embrace, in fact seek ambiguity. That means you are working on something that is still emerging or moving fast.
advice: Learn to build, bring others along, and tell your story
Job one is to build a great team. Job two is to remove hurdles in their path
Motion first, then direction. Don't be afraid to start paddling

front.name: Claire Bourke
front.quote: Brene Brown quote about being in the arena and feedback

back.lesson: The answer to what ever question you have is within - you just might need a great coach to ask the right questions.
advice: Learn to learn everyday. Curate a list of great and diverse inputs
Intentionally build and nuture your network
If you are comfortable, chances are you are not growing

front.name: Maureen Lonergan
front.quote: Leadership and innovation in technology

back.lesson: Build strong relationships and trust within your team and with customers.
advice: Focus on customer outcomes
Develop both technical and leadership skills
Create opportunities for others to grow

front.name: Jamie Simon
front.quote: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become - Wolfgang von Goethe

back.lesson: One obvious characteristic of the tech industry is that change is constant, and in many ways it is constantly accelerating.
advice: Be deliberate in where you want to be
One of the most valuable attributes is empathy
Be persistent, thorough and polite

front.name: Dave Coombes
front.quote: Knowing the name of something, is not the same as knowing something - Richard Feynman

back.lesson: Time is the only resource that you can't get more of. Be really intentional about what you say "yes" to and what you say "no" to.
advice: Skills development comes through intentional learning and career development comes through opportunity
Remember that although we work in technology, most of what makes work rewarding is the people
If you think something is wrong, speak up

front.name: Nick Blamey
front.quote: We don't wait for opportunities, we create them - Andy Jassy

back.lesson: Hiring against a set of well-defined principles or values has an enduring and powerful impact for tech organisations.
advice: Write about your projects, goals and ambitions regularly
Hire people who are better than you, coach them to find the role that will allow them to build on their strengths
You can't innovate in a vacuum

front.name: Tarik Makota
front.quote: I love it when a plan comes together - Colonel Hannibal Smith

back.lesson: As your responsibilities grow, your ways of working should be evolving from "doing work yourself" to "working thru others".
advice: Take ownership of your learning and sign up for stretch assignments
Long term goals over tasks, be flexible and adaptable in the journey
Effort is often underrated, start there

front.name: Tiffany Bloomquist
front.quote: Success is never achieved in your comfort zone

back.lesson: While you can be excited about an outcome, a goal or even a product you're creating, never, ever, lose sight of the impact you're driving for your customer.
advice: Follow your passion and curiosity!
Prioritize, prioritize, prioritize. Frugality of time is an important dimension
Balance the tasks that needed to be completed with the relationships

front.name: Rich Hua
front.quote: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give - Winston Churchill

back.lesson: A vital lesson I learned is the power of being a linchpin--making yourself uniquely valuable with an outsized impact.
advice: Be a super-absorbent learner. Always strive to discover and understand new things
Inspirational leadership comes from having high expectations + high care
Invest in developing your emotional and social intelligence skills
